name: Light and Crispy Fried Halibut
author: Dick Panzica
summary: Deep-fried halibut coated with panko bread crumbs makes the best fish and chips we've ever made or had.
ingredients: ½ (8 ounce) package panko bread crumbs
directions: Heat oil in a deep-fryer or large saucepan to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Whisk eggs, milk, and flour together in a shallow bowl
Stir panko bread crumbs and seasoned bread crumbs together in another bowl
Gently dip halibut squares into egg mixture, the press gently into bread crumbs mixture to generously coat completely
Place breaded halibut in a single layer on a plate while breading the rest
Cook halibut in preheated oil until golden brown and crisp on the outside, 4 to 6 minutes
